Reviews.Content: I've never owned a LED LCD television before, and I researched carefully for a solid one until I settled on Panasonic TC-L42E5 42-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED-LCD TV. I am really a stickler for picture quality, and after getting it in July 2013 and after many picture adjustments, I can be safe in typing that this is by far the best television I've had. The picture is super clear and pristine. The hookups to peripherals are a snap and easy. I've had my laptop hooked up to the television to play movies, and it works super easy. However, Panasonic TC-L42E5 42-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED-LCD TV claims to be WI-FI ready, but really, you need to connect it to the router. To let you know, I bought the television through Amazon Warehouses for $480, and I thought it was just as good as the new one. Sure, there is a bit of unnoticeable dent on the right top corner, but as long as the television works perfectly well, I am fine with it. All in all, the price on Panasonic TC-L42E5 42-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED-LCD TV is now high, but it's worth buying.My settings are:CustomBlack light +80Contrast +95Brightness +50Color +50Tint 0Sharpness +50Color Temp NormalColor Mgmt. OnAI Picture OnCATS OffVideo NR AutoFor Movies:StandardBlack light +58Contrast +95Brightness +50Color +50Tint 0Sharpness +81Color Temp NormalColor Mgmt. OffAI Picture OnCATS OffVideo NR Auto

Reviews.Title: The perfect TV !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Golfrichv
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this TV. With he IPS panel there is no loss of picture quality from any viewing angle, just clear as a bell. It's the perfect size for my 5th Wheel Trailer and can be viewed from any angle. The overall picture is astounding. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 42" TV
Reviews.Author: Steven E. Walker
Reviews.Content: This TV turned out to be a nice flat screen TV.  The price was reasonable for the TV and it has a very good picture.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and loaded with accessories inputs.
Reviews.Author: Graciano moniz
Reviews.Content: Good quality, great picture, ease of operation and set-up. Plenty of inputs and HDMI's. Fit in the entertainment center perfectly. It's lightweight and easy to handle. When I first received it I was appalled at the shipping package, but after removal it was apparent that it was well packed. The only negative part is that the speakers sound  minuscule, muffled and distorted. The problem is easily solved if you install a sound bar or separate speaker system. Just allow for the cost of such an addition.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture but Poor Audio
Reviews.Author: Parke D. Terry
Reviews.Content: Picture quality exceeded expectations but down-firing speakers deliver poor sound quality, especially if the set is placed in a cabinet.  Highly recommend adding a pedestal sound system (ZVOX Z-Base or Bose Solo) to make the set sound as good as it looks.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: zoe17
Reviews.Content: As this was a larger ($) purchase, I spent time researching and reading many reviews. TV was delivered in perfect condition - there wasn't even dirt on the box!  Easy to set up. Used the initial settings suggested by one of the other  Amazon reviewers (ggoblin); a longer review but one of the best I've ever seen. So far the TV is perfect. Excellent picture quality. I agree with the other reviewers that the sound could be a bit better, but the sound does match that of other tvs I've listened to in stores.  It's fine for now but I might upgrade in future. I would buy this tv again (but if I had more $or larger house would probably get one with a few more goodies on it.)

Reviews.Title: We got a deal
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: We happened to buy this item at the right time and it was an excellent purchase.  The quality is excellent, set up was easy and delivery was fast.  There is a review on here which gives an excellent guide to setting the settings for the best picture. If you are using the stand it does lean forward slightly, and this appears to be by design.  Really recommend this item.  It's everything in the description and more.

Reviews.Title: Good picture - fuzzy sound
Reviews.Author: RexroatEnergy
Reviews.Content: Setup was done by the dish satellite installer ($60)  and system works.  You might want to consider the setup something that can be done by mortals.  Setup on smaller TV (Vizio E221) totally failed and tv does not workpicture is good.Sound is uneven; some channels require a sound level of 20, some need a level of 75 or 80.  And on may channels it sounds like people are mumbling, hard to discern.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I got this on a Warehouse Deal, couldn't ask for more at the price. Crystal clear picture, syncs quickly with other components.

Reviews.Title: Luv it
Reviews.Author: Wessam Kamer
Reviews.Content: Great Product.. Awesome picture. low volume.  I ll get external speakers. no wi-fi but I connected to my laptop through an ethernet cable and it has internet now for Netflix and hulu.  I luv it.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: BDJG68
Reviews.Content: Simple to use, connected to Internet via Ethernet cable. all functions working as expected.  Very satisfied with Panasonic's Viera equipment, as have numerous Panasonic electronics in house

Reviews.Title: 37 inch tv
Reviews.Author: D. Wells
Reviews.Content: We got this tv for our bedroom.  Really like the internet features.  Had to buy the dongle to have wireless internet.  But that was easy to set up  just make sure you get the right one.  The only thing I wish was available on this tv is You-Tube, that was a disappointment - but we still enjoy it none the less.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Darknessmiko
Reviews.Content: I love this tv. It's worked well, and had no problems throughout the many moves I've had with it. Has great picture quality, and plenty of inputs. Only weird thing was the adapter for component/composite, but it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Sean Morrison
Reviews.Content: Extremely vibrant colors wide viewing angle and have it mounted on a wall opposite a window and there is no glare

Reviews.Title: Nice picture....but....
Reviews.Author: MartyDacat
Reviews.Content: We were replacing an older Sharp LCD TV (about 7 years old) with this Panasonic of the same size. The picture quallity is very good, a slight tendancy to be on the "dark side" no matter how it is adjusted....very acceptable. The only down side is the screen....it can be used as a mirror. We purchased the LCD model because the screens are usually better (less reflection) than plasma.....and planned on using it in a room with lots of windows. Needless to say, the old Sharp is in that room now. I'm very surprised the screens got worse over a period of time. We were planning on purchasing a much larger Panasonic plasma 3D TV in the near future, but are reconsidering the purchase now.

Reviews.Title: Overall a good tv
Reviews.Author: ricky
Reviews.Content: Picture is great but only one input for AV and the volume is kind of low but overall is a good tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very good, but not smart
Reviews.Author: Anthony H. Bastiand "Tony"
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this purchase. The quality of TV and on board sound is very good. This is my first LED, so it may just be that. As far as the extra features is concerned, this TV comes with a handful of apps for movies and shows but you cannot add or delete them so you're stuck with what you get. I have discovered that this is the norm unless you get a google tv or an apple tv, because even if other vendors advertise more, they will sooner or later discontinue their product. So my recommendation would be to buy this TV because of the quality and get a smart device separately.I watch a lot of soccer on HD, and on this TV the games look amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: David Reyes
Reviews.Content: It has a great picture and it is very light. Easy to move around and it is a great price. I usually go with Panasonic and I have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: Jen2
Reviews.Content: I have had good luck with Panasonic televisions before, so decided to try again.  The set-up is easy and the picture is great.  The only problem is the sound, but that is true of most flat screens.  I have a sound system hooked up, so that is not an issue.  The TV was well packaged and arrived in good shape.

Reviews.Title: A worthy upgrade
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 47" Panasonic LED on sale as a replacement for my 32" Sony LCD TV. Lifting the television says it requires a team lift, but if you're careful, you can manage this thing pretty easily and set it up by yourself on the stand. If you are wall mounting it I would recommend two people, however. I love pretty much everything about this TV, but I have some gripes with it as well.First of all, the size upgrade from 32" to 47" is very notable. I got lost in the size of this thing in my living room the first few days. The picture is also very clear and crisp.The jump from 720p to 1080p is also a huge difference, and my X360, PS3 and HD cable box look great. The TV is also notably better than my old Sony in a couple ways. First, the Sony would overheat after a few hours of continued use, and this one doesn't. It will also turn itself off after your HDMI input powers down, so if you fall asleep watching a movie or have to leave in a hurry it won't waste power. Also, the Sony would pick up the slight glare from the edge of the curtains and it would fog up the corner of the screen. The glare doesn't effect this new Panasonic at all. It is a very worthy upgrade in size, definition and build quality over my old TV.And while this TV still does deserve five stars, there are a few things that irritate me about it. For one, if you have old school game systems, the adapter that comes with the TV will only support one at a time, so if you switch between them you'll have to get behind your TV and switch them out. Not fun if your TV is up against a wall/corner or on a bulky oak stand like mine. Also, if you have old school audio, this TV is digital audio only. It will only support a toslink cable, and you can not use a digital-RCA splitter box as far as I know because this this TV does not give you the option for LR speaker sound. I can still wire my sub and standing speakers in with a digital system, but now I have to drop some money on some new speakers and an amp. I'm currently lining in to some cheap Logitech speakers until I can afford some new ones. I would not recommend using the built-in speakers in this TV, as they do not sound too great at all.Pros+Big enough screen for most rooms/people+Excellent picture quality+Doesn't pick up too much glare+Doesn't overheat after extended useCons-Built-in speakers are not that greatPros/Cons-If you have old school audio and video game systems like me, this TV will be a bit of a struggle.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV for under $400 (when it is onsale)
Reviews.Author: SweetHubby
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a 60hz, Panasonic claims as 180 BLS isn't really comparable to 120hz, in case if you are wondering or confused.USB Port DOES NOT READ USB-powered-HDD, don't blame the TV, it says clearly, Thumb Drive or SD Card ONLY.TV Remote control works well on the SONY Network MEDIA Player if you connected thru HDMI.THE BAD IS THIS TV DOES NOT HAVE RCA AUDIO OUT, the Chipset has Headphone output but This Model does not get the jack(50cents for part). Also, Panasonic is too cheap to throw the WiFi Part with the TV, cost for them is less than $10, they want to sell for $79 option. Just run the cable instead. Those are very minors but irritating for me to see them missing on today's TV.TV plays Beautiful pictures and 20w sounds loud enough for your 15x15 room, if larger, you need a digital amp or optical converter for your old school RCA outs.overall, I am happy with the purchase because I only paid less than $400, so there is no better 42 LED Smart TV as of May 2013.Walmart and Bestbuy has similar size TV with comparable spec for less than $300, don't let the price fool you, you want a TV that's good for years, not months.Brandname Smart TVs will be cheaper eventually, if you are shopping for a Good TV for cheap, wait for the deals on the Panasonic deals.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, terrible packaging
Reviews.Author: Brian E Statom
Reviews.Content: This TV was replacing a Hitachi 55" LED from Sam's.  The picture on this Panasonic was a night and day improvement over the Hitachi.  Great viewing angles (which is why the Hitachi went back) and the picture right out of the box required barely any adjustments.  The speakers do sound a little boxy from time to time but not too bad.  I don't like that the TV shares an audio input for both the PC and component inputs, no good but my mistake for not catching it.Really the only big negative was the packaging.  The box arrived dented on the back and the top of the box look ripped.  Sure enough the back of the TV was dented but thankfully I haven't noticed any problems with the picture such as uneven backlighting.  This was exactly the reason I was hesitant to purchase a TV online but the price was too good to pass up.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: golf4278
Reviews.Content: Trying to use as a monitor at work and the colors are not great.  Overall TV is very nice.  I would probably consider another brand if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, design and funtions!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing and the media player is awesome.  I've thrown a handful of codecs and it and so far it plays everything great... it even parses AC3 content to playback 5.1 via optical perfectly.  I got this open boxed for $340 and for that price this thing can't come close to being beat.  At full price it's still a great TV...

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Meryl Meyer
Reviews.Content: Everything about the TV was as advertised  Easy to use.  Pricing was great. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Software Problems on Panasonic VIERA
Reviews.Author: Jay Morrison
Reviews.Content: While I love my new Panasonic VIERA there is a software bug that is going to cost mea hell of a lot of work. There is no other way to report this problem back toPanasonic.  While they advertise that their television media player can handleMovies on a USB flash drive where the audio uses coded method AC-3,it doesn't completely work.  If you have a movie with sound AC-3, the soundwill play when the movie selector is looking at the thumbnail image.But if one actually plays the movie there is no sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Terry Sable
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this TV.  The sound needs to be amplified more.  That's the only thing I would recommend to make it a perfect TV.

Reviews.Title: Hard to find size
Reviews.Author: floridahometheaters
Reviews.Content: Good picture and feature set, if you need this size its a good TV. Would buy again and you would to.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV. Fit perfectly in available space
Reviews.Author: Carl Edson
Reviews.Content: The is an excellent TV. Great sound thru a YAS-101 speaker bar, excellent picture and color. Only draw back is no actual internet capability. The set only has pre programmed access for movies. Would have liked actual inter browsing capability. However it serves the purpose intended in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Clear image
Reviews.Author: Ringo
Reviews.Content: Just right size for my small apartment. Vierra link works fine with my Panasonic blue-ray player.Can watch Amazon instant video too.

Reviews.Title: Great set
Reviews.Author: Cleone  Wible
Reviews.Content: We had been checking out larger screen TV sets and were very happy with the reviews.  I had never ordered anything this large and fragile online before, but were very pleased when it arrived.  It was very easy to set up and we were watching it in about an hour.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: CO Shopper "pdb"
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with my new Viera TV. I needed to buy a new HDTV when I purchased a Blu-Ray player that didn't want to play on my old TV. The picture is great and I love the HDMI options/connectors available with the Viera.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV; good picture quality, thoughtful interface features and easy set-up...
Reviews.Author: 35-year Technology Consumer "8-tracks to 802.11"
Reviews.Content: The Viera TC-l37E5 offers superb picture quality at a very reasonable price for a 37" inch display. VERY particular about compatible adapters that may not be currently available.Pros:-Excellent picture quality. I placed this in a room with a high amount of natural ambient light, and the picture remained bright and crisp.-Easy integration into an existing A/V set-up.-Thoughtful user interface touches. For example, by selecting a "not used" option for input ports, they are removed from the input scrolling options.Cons:-VERY particular about which adapters are compatible to take advantage of online content. If you don't purchase the Panasonic TY-WL20U adapter, you'll have to consult Panasonic's web site for a list of alternatives (and pay attention, because each of the model number, hardware and firmware versions are specified).Overall, this is an excellent TV for its price.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap TV
Reviews.Author: Slater
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV. Good quality for a relatively low price. The Smart TV apps don't have much variety (all just movie-viewing apps a la Netflix), but with the Internet connectivity I can use the various DirecTV apps at my disposal.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV!!
Reviews.Author: James M. Galey "jmgaley"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome TV. Great features, great picture, etc. The only thing is the internal speakers are weak so I bought a surround sound system at the same time. All in all, I love my VIERA! One thing I don't like is no speaker out connections other than the fiber optic connection that goes to my surround system... I have a wireless earphone system that I had to rig through my Cable box.

Reviews.Title: I have found, over the years, that Panasonic products are quality products.
Reviews.Author: Duane Kinslow
Reviews.Content: My experience with several Panasonic TV's, digital cameras, and DVD players have all been very satisfactory. The quality of the products have been excellent and the ergonomics of the products and their remote controls is outstanding. For example, when I want to watch a movie, I turn on the DVD player and load a DVD. From that point everything is automatic...the TV turns on, the DVD player is selected as the source, and the main menu comes up. All I have to do is push the "Play" button and enjoy the movie.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Jane Blake "ladyj64"
Reviews.Content: This TV arrived right away and was easy to assemble. It's my first HD TV, so I can't compare it to others, but the picture is crisp and I've had no trouble with it.

Reviews.Title: Excelent!
Reviews.Author: Jose Francisco C
Reviews.Content: Excellent Product. All good, I recommend it. Good screen, good quality, the sound is not very loud, but okay. I like what I expected

Reviews.Title: Awesome, so worth it
Reviews.Author: C. Wolters
Reviews.Content: Compared to the more expensive sister model with 120Hz, I really don't see any noticeable difference. These are all great, Panasonic + IPS + LED makes for fantastic quality and welcome energy savings. Now they just need to last looooooong...

Reviews.Title: Best Christmas Gift Ever
Reviews.Author: Fred Kemper
Reviews.Content: A relative had an old TV for years and thought it was just fine, until she visited us and saw our 36" Panasonic LED TV. Rather than giving her a number of small gifts, we pooled resources and got the 42" model as a Christmas gift. It was personalized by copying a collection of family photos and music files to an SD card so she can have the screen saver display photos of her pets for hours. By including the Panasonic wireless adapter, installation and connection to her internet router was easy. Needless to say, the gift was a huge success

Reviews.Title: Nice extra TV for the bed room
Reviews.Author: TLC
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up and the HDTV pictures are crystal clear. Love the extra HDMI ports. Also, I can run my laptop screen on the TV with a 35 ft SVGA cable, but at lower resolution.Sound quality still has room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Great price!
Reviews.Author: George W Jones
Reviews.Content: Picture is great for this room, has a large window beside the TV. Sound not a factor because it is connected to surround sound system.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous Picture!
Reviews.Author: Joe Maggio
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this TV after owning a Magnavox 32" LCD for the past 4 years. My previous TV had a decent picture, though it was only 1080i.The Panasonic TC-L42E5 is far superior! The picture quality and color is amazing. The screen size is large for an apartment (it's almost like being in the movies). It's 1080p (though my cable provider (Time Warner) only provides 1080i. It's still an amazing picture, and Blu-Ray DVD looks very movie like.I'd highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Love the TV
Reviews.Author: evelyn1140 "evelyn1140"
Reviews.Content: i received the TV today. Easy to install and very nice picture. The only thing is negative about this TV is the volume is very low. Overall very happy with my TV I would like to ask what kind of wireless adapter this TV needs.

Reviews.Title: Decent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: Its pretty good - the back light is a little bit brighter than I would like, but still good.  Netflix app sucks and causes the screen to flicker occasionally, but I do not use it so w/e.

Reviews.Title: Pasonic
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Foran
Reviews.Content: Met all our expectations.  Have been shopping for a Pasonic for a few years and was leary of buying on line but TV is just what we expected.

Reviews.Title: Viera TC-L37
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Very good tv especially considering the very reasonable price! I mounted this tv on a wall/corner mount. Went up easily, I also added the wireless antenna.

Reviews.Title: We love it
Reviews.Author: audra65
Reviews.Content: Happy with this Panasonic . Nice picture and like the size. The shipping was slower than we liked but that is because I didn't have or phone nu. on Amazon. My mistake. The service was great once we received it and also the service men  put the tv up and did a good job.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Flat Screen TV
Reviews.Author: Rafe
Reviews.Content: This unit shows very good edge-to-edge color, runs cool and uses less electricity than one might expect, is easily switchable from one format to another. The colors are vivid and lively. Packaging was very good, and set-up was easy with the included documentation. All in all, it met all expectations, and viewers in this household are very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: No complaints
Reviews.Author: Snooze
Reviews.Content: Light, thin, good picture and sound.  Bought this to replace a "bargain" tv, with sound so bad it hurt my ears. Read that this Panasonic had great picture and sound, with option to connect thru computer.  Quite satisfied, and anticipate even better results once I change to upgraded cable/ FIOS service.  Not cheap, but worth the investment.  Ordered thru Amazon; so easy, and it arrived super fast.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TV
Reviews.Author: RFH
Reviews.Content: The TV set did everything that it was advertised to do.  Set up was a no-brainer as was connecting to the Internet.  If I were in the market for another 32" TV set I would buy this one.

Reviews.Title: FREAKIN AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Michael "Mouse"
Reviews.Content: I bought this HDTV to use as a monitor for my new MAC mini. Hook up was easy. Delivery from Amazon was slower than usual, but I suspect since the TV was brand new to the market, this was not within Amazon's control. Youtube videos are great at full screen. Would recommed this TV. I have only had the TV for a month so far. Will provide an update later.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Drew Dillon
Reviews.Content: Picture is great and it may not be Wifi ready out of the box but once you get the adaptor it is excellent!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L32E5
Reviews.Author: Kathy V
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for almost a year now.  Picture is as clear or clearer then my 50in Plasma made by the same manufacturer.  I was disappointed, at first, that the TV was only 60h not at least 120hz, but the action pictures have been great.  Would buy Panasonic again without question.  Will eventually replace my large Panasonic Plasma, in the living room,  with a large LED that consumes less energy.  The 32 inch works well in my bedroom.  Only complaint is that the remote should have had "back lightening" on it for use in bedrooms etc.  My large 50in TV has the "back lightening" feature which I rarely need/use.

Reviews.Title: Returning, like my old Panasonic better
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I bought this slightly larger 42 inch Viera to replace my 7 year old 39 inch Viera, thinking it would be an upgrade.I was wrong.  Although the viewing area is larger, the picture and sound quality is worse.  The picture looks dim and unfocused, despite correcting all the video options.  The audio is also very weak, with the sound projecting down and to the back.I'm dissappointed and decided to keep my older TV instead.  The color is more vibrant, and the sound is much better.  The newer unit reminded me of the old projection TV's, where the picture quality is lacking.

Reviews.Title: Solid, no-nonsense performance at a great price
Reviews.Author: Sri "Sri"
Reviews.Content: Got this Panasonic Viera 42" TV today, after having purchased it on Amazon for a very good price recently ($ 370). As another recent reviewer has mentioned, the packaging (external cardboard box) looked a little beat-up and I don't know if that is Amazon's or the delivery peoples' fault. Regardless, this TV is a good buy, especially for the price. I researched other TVs quite a bit before getting this TV, and I am satisfied with it.Pros: 4 HDMI inputs, not much junk-ware, video quality is good, bezel is smaller and overall the TV is thinner than other similar LED/LCD TVs at this price point.Cons: Audio could use some improvement.*Get this TV especially if you want to cut the cord with respect to cable TV.* I say this because I feel like the best combination for streaming TV online is to get a good, basic TV (non-'smart', non-3D, 60-120 Hz, 1080p LED/LCD) and hook it up to Roku 3. I have seen very expensive smart TVs that don't get used to their full potential because the apps are insufficient or quickly out of date. This TV and the Roku 3 seem to work great together, and as a bonus I now have 3 HDMI ports left for hooking up consoles or my laptop later on.

Reviews.Title: Thin  design  low watt use  perfect for motorhomes
Reviews.Author: william borie
Reviews.Content: This 37 inch in TV with its sliim design and low power consumtion makes this a great fit to replave a 32 inch TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Daryl in AZ
Reviews.Content: Im going to beef up the sound quality somehow, but this is a great TV. So far so good.Perfrect size for smaller room.

Reviews.Title: A couple minor annoyances but overall happy with purchase.
Reviews.Author: Zak
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to replace a defective 37 inch Samsung flat screen TV that I owned for less than a week.  I was tempted to buy another Samsung since I've owned several in the past and have generally been happy with them but after doing some additional research I learned that Samsung now uses 4 different manufacturers for the panels in their TV and they can vary quite a bit in quality depending on brand.  This means that the picture quality of the Samsung will vary depending on how lucky you are and what brand panel you receive in your set.  The bottom line is that I was not willing to take a chance on another Samsung and end up with another low quality Chi Mei branded panel in my set so I decided to go with the Panasonic 37 inch TV instead even though it was almost $130 more than the Samsung.Overall I am happy with the TV and have decided I will keep it even though I have a few gripes with it.  Even after adjusting the factory video settings on the Panasonic both my wife and I agreed the Samsung colors were slightly more vivid.  Please don't interpret this to mean the Panasonic has a bad picture. Like I said the picture quality is VERY GOOD and we probably would not have noticed the difference had we not had both TV's running at the same time side by side.  Now for my main gripes about the TV.....Which genius engineer at Panasonic thought it would be a good idea to place the speakers facing the rear of the TV??  I am dumfounded as to why anyone would design a TV so that the sound is projected away from the viewer.  Basically the sound quality is terrible on this TV and it's hard to hear anything unless you turn the volume way up or use an external speaker system.  Turning the volume up is not a very acceptable solution in my opinion because the speakers start sounding very "tinny" and somewhat distorted especially at higher volumes.  I decided to go with an external speaker system which works great in terms of audio quality but it also leads to my second main gripe.  The Panasonic only has a optical audio output which means you will need to buy a digital to analog converter and a Toslink cable if you plan on hooking up your TV to an older set of wireless headphones or an older audio system that uses composite cables.  These converters sell for around $20 but keep in mind that with optical audio you will not be able to use the TV remote to lower or raise the volume and will need to control the volume directly through your stereo receiver remote or headphone volume knob.  The Samsung has both a digital and analog audio output using a standard 3.5mm audio jack on the back so you wouldn't run into that issue.On a positive note the Panasonic is heavier and feels much more solid and well built that the Samsung which is made primarily of plastic.  Another positive feature is the Panasonic's online movie functionality which we found to be great!!  We never used Netflix before but we started the free 1 month trial and have liked it enough that we have decided to keep the subscription service after the trial period expires.  Our TV is hooked to the internet through an ethernet cable using a powerline adapter but this should work fine via wireless if we later decide to purchase the optional wireless adapter.  I realize you can get this same functionality from 3rd party products such as the Roku streaming player but it is nice having the functionality built directly into the set.***********************  UPDATE  04/08/2013  ***********************I've now owned this TV for more than a week and while I am quite happy with the picture quality and Netflix movie functionality I am becoming increasingly annoyed with the optical audio output issue. If you plan on using the built in speakers only this issues should NOT affect you but if you plan on using external speakers or headphones you should be made fully aware of these issues.  I have a Vizio sound bar that has both an analog and an optical audio input on it but when I connect it directly to the optical output on the TV only certain channels provide sound.  It turns out that is due to the fact that some programs are broadcast using Dolby sound and many sound bars and wireless headphones do not support Dolby sound.  This means that you will either have to live with switching between your external speakers/headphones and using the built in speakers or you'll have buy a digital to analog converter that will decode Dolby sound.  The cheap $20 digital to analog converter I bought previously to use with my wireless headphones does not decode Dolby so I had the same problem with only getting external audio with certain program and movies.  I ended up having to spend $40 to buy another converter that does decode Dolby sound.  The new converter seems to be working fine but there have been a few instances where the sound will suddenly cut out completely (while using Netflix only) and won't come back unless I stop the Netflix broadcast completely and then re-start it using the "resume" feature.  I'm not sure if this is a Netflix issue or a Panasonic issue but nonetheless it is still annoying but manageable. All of this could have easily been avoided if Panasonic had simply included an analog audio output on the TV like the Samsung has.I've provided a link below for the correct converter you will need that will Decode Dolby sound.CE Compass Digital SPDIF / Coaxial to Analog L/R RCA Audio Decoder w/ 3.5mm Headphone Jack

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Very Happy
Reviews.Author: J. Szuchy
Reviews.Content: I gave this product 4 stars because the default settings, as others have mentioned, leave a lot to be desired.  Thanks to another Amazon review, I was able to adjust the TV to a quality that I'd expect; I did make my own tweaks, upping the brightness and color.Another drawback is the need to plug in the TV via ethernet versus allowing a wireless connection; however, I always prefer wired connections, but I think it is worth mentioning.  Additionally, I did not see the VESA mounts at first, but they are hidden behind some slick covers.The television itself is lightweight, produces a beautiful picture, and all of the "smart" aspects make it extremely desirable, especially for the price.  Coming from a 37" 720p Vizio, I could not be happier.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great
Reviews.Author: JRicoC
Reviews.Content: The unit has a good picture for an LED display, handles motion well and has plenty of inputs.  My knocks against it are that the included stand is very low, so you cannot place a center-channel speaker in front of the display, as its infrared sensor would be blocked.  The second, more serious knock is the fact that the unit's HDMI inputs do not pass a 5.1 audio signal to the optical output.  I ended up buying a receiver and essentially bypassing the TV and its onboard HDMI inputs.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what i wanted
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: So far so good, great picture and image i'm completely satisfied with this product, and glad i choose over all others.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality not as good as my Panasonic plasma
Reviews.Author: NTT
Reviews.Content: Set-up was easy and Viera features are great, but picture quality is not what I'm used to with my Panasonic plasma. The 37 inch screen is a perfect fit for the cabinet space because of the 1-inch bezel. Overall it was the best option since I couldn't find a plasma that would fit the space.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, easy to set-up, wifi needs better instructions
Reviews.Author: wnc
Reviews.Content: I love everything about it except when I did my research in the fall the Panasonic salesperson told me I could use my xbox wifi adaptor so that I wouldn't have to buy a Panasonic adaptor ($$$). That wasn't true. christmas day we were looking forward to checking out the wifi and our xbox adaptor did not work. Upon reading the manual, it says clearly you need the Panasonic one for that model. I googled some more and found out I could use last year's model adaptor and found one on eBay, saving me approx. $20 but it won't be here until Jan 4.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Yojana Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Definitivamente superó mis expectativas en calidad de imagen, sobre todo con Blu-Ray. Para mi, el precio fue insuperable. estoy FELIZ con mi compra.

Reviews.Title: Kickass HD TV
Reviews.Author: snosgr8
Reviews.Content: Have been looking to get into the 21st C with a TV.  Gr8 product.  Crisp colors.  Was concern about the 60hz refresh rate.  Not an issue on this size screen.  Have not had to do any screen adjustment though one can find suggestions on this site, in other reviews, as to what other people have done.  This TV got right up to speed outta the box.  It does stink that it needs an add on to connect to the internet. I am leaning towards Google TV from Sony as there is way more that one can connect to than there are apps on any TV.  For now I am running off my iPad for such a connection, which is really easy to do.  Same cost as the dongle, more options.  For a 32" option, this is a gr8 way to go.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy as a "smart" tv
Reviews.Author: M. Jameson "Mijam7"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a smart tv then there is no reason to purchase this product. Two things I found out after a bought it: it is not wireless! If you want to connect wirelessly you have to buy a special Panasonic adapter. Second, it can not connect to the Viera market and download apps! You are stuck with Netflix, Hulo, and Amazon movies. That being said, the "smart" tv is really stupid. If you are going to get a smart tv make sure it is actually smart. I feel like I was duped with this purchase and I won't be buying another Panasonic product.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: Gary Salva
Reviews.Content: I've had a Sony tube tv for the longest and it took this tv to get me to switch to a flat panel. I think it's that good!

Reviews.Title: smart tv
Reviews.Author: B. George
Reviews.Content: Love the apps, picture quality is great. the reason that I'm giving it a 4 instead of a five star is for two reasons one the netflix button on the remote does not always work and the TV stand does not swivel. The non swiveling stand may not sound like an issue but when you have to lift and move the whole TV, it matters*UPDATE* Rating reduced to 1 star the sound quality on this tv is horrible, you have to adjust all the audio setting on the tv to 10 just to barely hear anything and my tv is only 10ft away from me!

Reviews.Title: Not quite what was expected
Reviews.Author: hiep vo
Reviews.Content: This TV was a gift for my fiance's family, as they were still using an old CRT at home.  I had purchased the TC-L42E50 model for myself already, which had slightly better specs during the Cyber Monday deals (2012).What I thought was the only difference was that the TC-L42E5 had a refresh rate of 60hz, but my TC-L42E50 had 120hz.  Both have Viera Link, and I had assumed that all the apps included would be the same, but that isn't true.  On the TC-L42E5, it has Netflix and other apps, but no Youtube.  My fiance had hoped that it would have the Youtube app so that her parents could watch Chinese videos on Youtube.  Doesn't make too much sense as to why Panasonic would leave out a mere app, even though the TV is internet ready.  So what they have to depend on is using a PC to watch Youtube videos on the TV - an inconvenient workaround...I can't review the picture/sound quality as my fiance's parents live in another state.  But if the only main technical difference is the refresh rate, then I'm sure the quality is pretty good for a TV at this price, as I have no complaints about the model I picked up for myself - the TC-L42E50So... what we accomplished is getting rid of their old CRT TV.  But unfortunately it didn't come with the main feature/app they were looking for.  Hence the 3 stars.  If the Youtube app is important in your consideration on buying a new TV, step up to the TC-L42E50.

Reviews.Title: joe
Reviews.Author: jscilla
Reviews.Content: I already owned a panasonic 37" E3, which I am very satisfied with.  The price on the E3 went up to $797, so I decided to go with the E5 42" at $628.  The E5 is thereplacement for the E3 and has similar specs.  Am disappointed in picture qualityin that it just doesn't have the sharpness and 'pop' that my E3 has.  Its notbad, but I was really looking for the same quality.  Other than that its the same as the E3.Update:  I forgot to mention that the E3 gets facebook and pandora whereas the E5 does not.

Reviews.Title: joe
Reviews.Author: jscilla
Reviews.Content: I already owned a panasonic 37" E3, which I am very satisfied with.  The price on the E3 went up to $797, so I decided to go with the E5 42" at $628.  The E5 is thereplacement for the E3 and has similar specs.  Am disappointed in picture qualityin that it just doesn't have the sharpness and 'pop' that my E3 has.  Its notbad, but I was really looking for the same quality.  Other than that its the same as the E3.Update:  I forgot to mention that the E3 gets facebook and pandora whereas the E5 does not.

Reviews.Title: The joke is on me-finally entered the digital world and got body slammed by Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Viejo Majadero
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is fantastic,but the sound and mouth movements are out of synq.  Asked Panasonic for helpI wrote this, "Have OPTIMUM Cablevision HDTV. Use Samsung cable box. Use HDMI line to connect box to my TC-L32E5. Cannot get voice sound and lips of people in sync. Appears voice comes first then lips move a fraction later.Please advise fix.And was told this,"This unit has automatic lip-sync function. However, this function needs an HDMI compliant (fully wired) cable. Non-HDMI-compliant cables cannot be utilized. It is recommended that you use Panasonic?s HDMI cable. Recommended part number: RP-CDHS15 (4.9 ft/1.5 m), RP-CDHS30 (9.8 ft/3.0 m), RP-CDHS50 (16.4 ft/5.0 m)."So here I am with a TV that drives me nuts, bought a new Panasonic BlueRay and a new Onkyo receiver so all this digital stuff can communicate and I am out a lot of money.  And by the way using the Panasonic BluRay to the TV is out of synq also so it is not the Cable line. It is the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but...
Reviews.Author: Redd Bird "ReddBird"
Reviews.Content: But...if you want anything Internet (Netflix, Amazon streaming, etc) you must buy a Panasonic wi-fi adapter for an additional $75 bucks. Come on! After spending $700 can't Panasonic shove one in the box? I went to Best Buy and bought a generic Belkin wi-fi adapter figuring that all of those things are the same. Well guess what dear friends, they are not. I just wanted to shove it up Panasonic's wi-fi poop shoot but I found out that they have a bigger dick. Other brands do not work. They design it that way. I finally had to spend another $75 for a friggin' Panasonic adapter and that worked......sort of. Sort of means that it doesn't always connect to my wi-fi network. I tried repositioning the adapted and that worked....sort of. So....I bought a Belkin wi-fi extender to amplify the signal to the second floor and the $75 Panasonic adapter. That worked.....sort of. It's much better now but WTF! I spent $700 for the TV, $50 for the Belkin adapter, $75 for the Panasonic adapter and $80 for the Belkin wi-fi extender. I could have gotten a larger screen from another manufacturer for the same money (but with no Internet). Footnote....the picture is amazing. Sound is good. It's a sad commentary when the features you expect from a TV are just footnotes.

Reviews.Title: I Love It
Reviews.Author: Aubrey
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat screen tv I bought and such a great deal it was. The price was exactly. I am only 24 so still on a budget. Definitely a great tv so far. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, easy set-up
Reviews.Author: James F. Ripka
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived well packed.  Set-up was easy and the picture is beautiful with a good viewing angle.  I use a home theatre system so I cannot comment in the internal speakers.  I've had it about 4 months and it has worked flawlessly.  I recommend this TV to anyone looking for a new TV

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: J. S. "JJJJJ"
Reviews.Content: I've had my TH-L32E5A for about 6 weeks now and I'm quite pleased.When I did my pre-purchase research I focused on the negative reviews written about each type of smart tv.  I saw lots of problems with setup, establishing a wifi connection, sound quality, color quality and finally settled on this Panasonic as my best bet.I am currently in South America so the chances of getting any kind of service or help are minimal.Things I like:Setup was quite easy even though we didnt read the instructions, just used them when we had a problem.  We got stumped once before we found an on-off switch behind the set.  Otherwise it went quickly.It connected to the wifi immediately.The picture is very good.The controls are simple and easy to understand.  I haven't used the manual since early in the setup.Things I wish were better:It can only access netflix and a few other websites that I'm not really interested in.  So, until theres somekind of a performance enhancement in this area the whole concept of internet access is useless to me.I was easily able to connect it to my Macbook via cables and display websites and downloaded material on it.  But, with 2 active dogs in the house, I'm  quite reluctant to use this method of connection.  I've been looking for a wireless connection but the state of the art isnt there yet.  So far the best I've found is to put my Macbook next to the tv and use a wireless mouse to control the Macbook which is cable connected to the tv.In summary, it does every thing promised quite well.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade to my 42-inch LCD
Reviews.Author: C-ROCK
Reviews.Content: I knew I would be getting a second TV in 2012 and thanks to a slick deal, I got this one.  It's bright, doesn't take forever to turn on, it's thin, it's LED.The only downside to this is that I can't hook up my somewhat low-end logitech speakers.  There is no analog audio out.  At some point I have to buy new speaker system or an optical to analog converter.....boo.  The internal speakers are adequate for casual video games and most TV shows.

Reviews.Title: Met requirements
Reviews.Author: rcc
Reviews.Content: Netflix capable PC in 37in size. Older entertainment center. Price OK but not outstanding. Enjoying streaming with ethernet cable. Hope they solve wireless issue

Reviews.Title: MOSTLY GOOD
Reviews.Author: treffler2
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this set.  The one thing I didn't realize was that flat sceen TV's don't have very good speakers.  I had to buy a soundbar to augment it.

Reviews.Title: easy setup
Reviews.Author: Aaron M Gray
Reviews.Content: We have been very pleased after 2 months of use. The picture is great. The number and types of inputs have suited all of our needs. We did get fooled by Wii. We read that a special adapter was needed. we bought two, each of which gave an awful picture. We stuck with the standard wii wires and it looks great.

Reviews.Title: Great leap forward, but ...
Reviews.Author: GinnyR "No"
Reviews.Content: Not the sharpest picture, but it's probably me.  Did the initial setup.  One of these days, I'll:- install the new high-speed router that's still sitting in the box that I bought to be able to see Amazon streaming videos on this new fancy TV, and-figure out how to connect the computer to the new TV for the same purpose, and-then read all the fine print about how to adjust the picture so it's FINE-tuned, and-figure out how to get back to using only one remote for both channel selection and volume control.I'm not generally technophobic, but I dilly-dallied a long time about these (2) new TVs, just because of the necessity of router setup for the Amazon streaming video, which I hope to exploit soon.  For security and privacy, I don't like the idea of a constantly-on wireless network in the house, so I'll probably buy a cheap additional computer to hard-wire to the TV.  (When I was younger, TV was simpler.  Nevertheless, I'm looking forward to occasional internet use via TV.)  This TV may deserve 5 stars, but it hasn't yet thrilled me that much.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased, if I could only find a dongle to go with it....
Reviews.Author: USERBOSCO
Reviews.Content: Slim, great aesthetics, fantastic picture, easy set-up, and wifi ready...now if I could only find a wifi dongle somewhere on planet earth.  The NetGear replacement/alternative will not work with this series TV...bummer  :-)  Highly recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: High-Def TV makes Low-Def programs look good
Reviews.Author: W. H. Bent Jr. "Comics, music and more"
Reviews.Content: Call me behind the times - we finally got rid of our CRT television, which still looks great after 15+ years. But, to cut to the chase, this TV looks better, even on analog cable TV shows. DVDs look sharp and bright. That was all well and good, but when we streamed "Up" from Vudu, we were amazed - even at regular HD and not their HDX format, every pixel from Pixar came shining through. Dazzling!The 42" size fits well in our living room, and plugging in DVD via HDMI was simple, as was plugging it into our home network. (We went with Wired Ethernet, both for speed and for cost.) We're still exploring all the features, but so far, so good.

Reviews.Title: Meets all my needs
Reviews.Author: azman
Reviews.Content: Great picture, wide viewing angle is as promised.  One small irritant.  There is an on/off indicator light below the screen that is on when the set is on.  Rather annoying.  I put a piece of black tape over it.  I like the Samsung approach where the indicator is on when the set is off.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, good sound quality, low volume, limited audio/video inputs
Reviews.Author: A Normal Guy
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews on this TV, I decided to get this one.  I have been very pleased and feel that this is a great tv, especially for the money (great "bang-for-the-buck").The good: the picture quality is great.  Nice level of lighting and colors.  We REALLY wanted a TV that had a matte finish and not the gloss, and this TV fits the bill great.  There is very minor reflection regardless of lighting level.The sound QUALITY is good, but like other reviewers have noted, the volume is low.  It is passable without a stereo, but some movies are so quiet that you will probably want some kind of sound amplification at some point.The only "bad" things I noted with this TV is the low volume (which is low, but not near a deal breaker) and the limited number and types of audio/video inputs it accepts.  This can be overcome with a switcher, but is unfortuneate.Overall, it's a great buy.  I would not hesitate to get it again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic 37 inch 1080p LED-LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis Davis
Reviews.Content: Received it very quickly without any damage. Setup is fast and default settings provide a good image.Have other Panasonic TV's and love the images they provide.This TV is a great value.

Reviews.Title: What's Not to Like
Reviews.Author: Donald M. Martin
Reviews.Content: Great picture, decent sound and a good size at a decent price.Why aren't concise reviews allowed? Dumb, dumb, dumb!

Reviews.Title: great purchase but no browser
Reviews.Author: Heather Johnson
Reviews.Content: The internet widgets don't include an internet browser (which I expected to be included) but everything else is fantastic. Great picture and sound for the price.

Reviews.Title: Amazin TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. The product description had stated that there was a small dent on the backside of the TV. When it arrived it was packaged perfect I took it out and took a look the dent has no significance it was about a half inch big on the left hand top side of the back of the TV. Nowhere near near the plung-ins for the SD carded USB HDMI Etc…. I don’t mind one bit it was about $100 cheaper, I have Amazon prime so I got this with free shipping and it came within 3 days of purchasing it. Amazing quality perfect amount of HDMI cable ports, the TV is perfectly sharp and works effectively. I really do enjoy this TV the price is so right and well worth everything buying it from Amazon. I was also very surprised on how thin the TV is. Its 1 inch thick from front to back and it also comes with a nifty stand if you can’t hang up your TV on the wall. So basically don’t be discouraged if the description says there’s a small dent or its damaged in some way it still works very well! I do not regret buying this TV at all amazing High Deff on Sports, cooking channels even movies. I love it!!

Reviews.Title: From Sony to Panasonic that was a hard decision
Reviews.Author: Ada B
Reviews.Content: My old one 26 inches and now my Panasonic 36 inches.I am in heavens....I live in a very small apt. and this TVis perfect.Now I can see my movies and enjoyed it.It is a wonderful TV....I am in love with Panasonic...good bye Sony Bravia.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: llacosse
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to "watch TV!".  I'm not a gamer or such.  Sometimes view DVDs also.  Quality is up there.  This unit has a steel back plate/frame, not plastic.  I picked this model because the outside dimensions fit in my current entertainment center.  Because Panisonic is a well known name brand I expected the picture quality to be excellent, but not so.  The picture using HD channels is fare at best no matter how much I adjust the settings.  My previous TV was a Sansui 32" bought at a local big retailer store for 280 bucks.  It had a much better picture.Plenty of inputs in the back.  Four HDMI and two USB.  But!!!  No standard RCA stereo outputs.  I run the audio to my stereo system. My system is exactly that... a two channel stereo amp, not 5.1 Dolby.  I'd easily give up two HDMI inputs to have the RCA audio out so I could take advantage of the TV's built in surround sound. I now use the audio out from my cable box.Overall somewhat disappointed with Panisonic for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a few weeks
Reviews.Author: Andrew G.
Reviews.Content: Picture quality was OK - certainly not the best, but acceptable for the price.  You also get a lot of inputs, and the on-line capabilities.  HOWEVER - I had this for a few weeks, then all of a sudden woke up to see that it had gone into "stand by" mode (screen off, power light blinking at a regular pattern.)  Manual states to unplug for a few minutes and re-plug so that it can reset itself, but now all I get is a vertical bar on one side of the screen, no picture, then it shuts off again and goes back into blinking mode.  Fortunately I am within the 30 days so I should be able to send back - but this is a shame.  I really wanted to like this TV due to its design and features, and was willing to live with the only-average picture quality.

Reviews.Title: TV is great, but PC connection is only 720p
Reviews.Author: Cameron
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV for viewing angle and capabilities for wifi, smartphone remote, .... but it's inadequate for use as a high-def computer monitor.I have some experience connecting a PC or a MacMini to HDTVs, using VGA or HDMI. Plus, customer service confirmed I had properly setup my PC to TV connection.The PC/Mac computer input by either VGA or HDMI into this HDTV is only 720p(!!!), despite the TV being 1080p. Customer service explained that the HDTV is not 1080p "pure direct" .. Pure direct 1080p is only available in the 2011 e3 and dt30 models (for the 32 inch size); it's also standard in the larger and pricier models. Non-"pure direct" 1080p is what I am now returning (32 inch e5 series).One star for misleading me into thinking that a 1080p HDTV could handle 1080p PC/Mac input. Nowhere did it indicate a difference between 1080p and 1080p pure direct.

Reviews.Title: Not a good buy.
Reviews.Author: Lew Graff
Reviews.Content: Picture not as sharp as my Mitsubishi. Color hard to adjust. Set is just ok. I should have sent it back, but will live with it.

Reviews.Title: Amazon purchase
Reviews.Author: Cathy L Mullaney
Reviews.Content: We love our new TV. This was our Christmas present to each other.i was very happy with the delivery and the way it was packed was amazing. I will recommend to everyone, that amazon is the best way to go. The price was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: paul brooks
Reviews.Content: This T.V. was re-packaged and I believe it was broken before it was packed. It was sent to me broken , not like new!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L32E5
Reviews.Author: David V.
Reviews.Content: This is the new product for TV from Panasonic.  The date code of this TV is Jan.2012 and before I decide to buy this TV, I make a lot of research about LED- LCD TV and compare it to other product of Samsung, Sony,GE.  This is the latest product  with reasonable price and I know that I make a right choice.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable TV
Reviews.Author: A. Gerhardt
Reviews.Content: We bought the Viera for our bedroom. Good thing we don't watch much TV in there because it only works sporadically. It's a hit or miss. Mostly the power light just blinks on and off but the TV rarely comes on. We've always been big Panasonic fans but this product missed the mark by a long shot. We have been able to get no support. After searching online for problems with this product, it seems we aren't the only people who have experienced the power issue.If you want a really great TV look at the Samsung - and they have great customer service.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera 32"
Reviews.Author: M3
Reviews.Content: Having sold a Sharp Aquos (I moved and was concerned it wouldn't make the trip well), I got to my new location and needed to buy a new TV. i did alot of research and read alot of reviews and decided on the Panasonic Viera. It is very light, but the picture seems too small to be a 32" or maybe I remembered the size of my Sharp incorrectly. It has a good picture, but I don't really like any of the viewing "formats". Not sure if I would like the Viera better if I had gotten a bigger size, but I miss my old (08) Aquos. I propbably would have bought another one (Aquos) but couldn't find one I could afford. This size Viera is definitly better suited for a den or bedroom (small ones...) and I have it in the L.R. I would have returned it but I needed something to watch!  Picture is very good, and the view even from the side is clear without distortion.

Reviews.Title: Bad First Impression!
Reviews.Author: Bob Drake "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I took it out of the box and immediately noticed I was missing 4 screws for the base/pedestal.I knew it would take days to get replacements, so my helper(I was just 2 weeks post knee replacement surgery} went to a bolt store and got the right screws.At the bolt store they tried putting them in and couldn't get the 2 pieces to sit properly.So we put it together anyway and the TV tilted to the right and forward..I fixed it with cd's under the base.Called Panasonic C.S. and triedto talk to a lady with a heavy accent.The way I understood it was she would send the missing screws and i would have to FAX all kinds of info to get a new base/pedestal. I told her I didn't have access to a fax machine but would try new screws 1st.In the mean time I tried out the TV and no matter how I set the settings I wasn't happy with the picture.Not even close to the 4 year old panasonic plasma tv that I have.  Anyway, I called cust. serv. 2 weeks later to find out that they didn't send out the missing screws because I didn't send a FAX.That was the last straw. I knew I had a 30 day free buyback plan with Amazon so I researched Consumer Reports for a replacement. They recommended a Samsung LCD 40".So I ordered it and 4 days later it was delivered by UPS.Put it together the next day and put the panasonic back in the box.Amazon said they'd take care of telling UPS to pick up the panasonic.UPS came the next day and got it.  The Samsung is amazing. It has a picture that is better than my 4 year old Panasonic plasma.I would like to thank Amazon for all their help, and say to anyone thinking about buying a Panasonic LED to think again.

Reviews.Title: So far not good
Reviews.Author: Mohammad A. Khalil
Reviews.Content: The price is great. The TV...meh. The amount of apps are limited. No App store. NetFlix, Vudu, Hulu Plus, Cinema NOW and Amazon. Great selection. If you want more though, get a Roku.It was having problems working with my ATT uVerse Box. Kept flickering till it had no connection at all. I got a technician coming out tomorrow to replace the box, hoping thats the problem. I won't know until tomorrow though, because its a new box and I haven't been able to test it anywhere else.I have the TV hooked up via Ethernet to my router. The Netflix apps works awesome, and so does the Vudu. Vudu HDX looks awesome on this set. I did a speed test with the Vudu app and it remained over 9mbps the whole time (my internet is 12mpbs). So that was good. UNFORGIVABLY, the Hulu APP IS TRASH. Hulu has 4 bandwith modes, 650kbps, 1mbps, 2mbps(HD), and 3.2mbps(HD). The HD Streams DO NOT WORK. They constantly lag in and out and work for only a second or two. This is a BIG DEAL. I even updated the TV Software to the latest, but no luck.

Reviews.Title: PC Input Doesn't Handle 1920x1080 even though the TV is 1080p
Reviews.Author: Charlie "charlie615"
Reviews.Content: According to the manual, even though the HDMI input can handle 1080p,  the PC Input is only capable of displaying up to 1366x768.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-L47E5 47-Inch 60Hz LED-Lit TV
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: As for being a TV it is fine, but it isn't what they say it is, it is a LCD and not a LED the picture is fine the back light dose help it, and the speckers face the back and it is a little hard to understand it and it maks it sound off track, and if you asd a specker bar the sound gets even worse. So I would not tell any one to buy this one, any Panasonic in no longer in Bussiness

Reviews.Title: not  wireless ready as advertised
Reviews.Author: skymist
Reviews.Content: This TV proclaims to be wireless internet ready. It is not. You have to  buy a $67 wireless adapter to make it work. This adapter is not available anywhere and won't be for another month.  I would have purchased a different TV had I known this!  If you want internet don't buy this TV.I haven't used it yet so I can't comment on anything else.

ProductInfo.Features:
Full HD IPS LED Panel
Wi-Fi Ready, Online Movies
Media Player (SD and USB)
Thin LED Design: TV without stand (Width x Height x Depth): 43.6-Inch x 26.3-Inch x 1.6-Inch, TV with stand (Width x Height x Depth): 43.6-Inch x 28.1-Inch x 10.6-Inch
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic TC-L47E5 47-Inch 60Hz LED-Lit TV
